meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The old door klanged shut behind him.
meanings.sent2: The metal pipes klang when struck with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The wind made the chimes klang in a strange melody.
meanings.sent4: His voice klanged through the empty room, startling everyone.
meanings.sent5: The church bells klanged in the distance, signaling the start of the ceremony.
